author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
It does not seem likely that users will confuse PtFEM, a project to reproduce some Fortran software from a book, with ParFEM.jl, a library package for parallelization of FEM computations.

[noblock] A couple of suggestions, if I may.

There's not currently any documentation or examples on how to use the package. It would be a lot easier to understand what the package is capable of doing if you wrote the README. I see that you have docstrings, which is great! It would be relatively straightforward to setup a GitHub hosted page using Documenter.jl so that users can understand how to interact with your API.

Based on the [Package Naming Guidelines](https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines) to "avoid acronyms", it could be a bit easier to read and aligned with the guidelines to name your package something like ParallelFEM.jl.

I'm okay with the name, personally, although I agree it's not great. However, some minimal documentation is mandatory before this can be merged. [At the very least](https://discourse.julialang.org/t/when-does-it-make-sense-to-post-a-new-package-to-the-julia-repository/108701/4), that would be a description to give some context for the package and a small usage example in the README. I'd second setting up a Documenter-based site to show the docstrings in addition to that, even though that's not generally a requirement for registration.
I see where you are coming from. I will choose a different name. Docs are a WIP.

This pull request has been inactive for 30 days and will be automatically closed 7 days from now. If this pull request should not be closed, please either (1) fix the AutoMerge issues and re-trigger Registrator, which will automatically update the pull request, or (2) post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. [noblock]
This pull request has been inactive for more than 30 days and has automatically been closed. Feel free to register your package or version again once you fix the AutoMerge issues. [noblock]
